Content: also, python has different ways of seeing if the key of a dict exists, and one way raises an exception and the other does not

Content: foo["bar"] will raise an exception if the key doesn't exist, but I believe foo.get("bar") will not, it returns undefined or something

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and i can't remember if it's the same in py2 and py3, but I think yes

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640

```if 'bar' in foo:
   print("woohoo")
else:
  foo['bar'] = "figjam"```

Author: JohnnyC#2488
Content:
I know this isn't really a dICO, but there's a swiss company hoping to run an ICO adhering to KYC regulation, and have a few thousand dollars to put into a good ICO dashboard. I want to support komodo/the community so if it's possible to do (not really decentralized), would anyone be willing to give a quote? 
Here are the requirements;
Presale of NFT indicating a set SuperNode, which will receive a % of bought back tokens quarterly.
Main sale of regular currency.
Competitive supernodes: quarterly top 10 holders are locked in for next quarter, receiving same benefits as set Supernodes.

Their main application is built on HyperLedger, and the main use of the token will be purchase of their services. 

If this is possible, please send any quote you have 😄 Thanks in advance, and I hope I can inject a bit of support to the Komodo community if possible. (Don't undersell yourself, and give as realistic a quote as possible).

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: @miraculu py pip has a komodorpc library, what lang do u need ?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
for py, in #kmdlabs  we've been mostly using slickRPC. By using the function here - https://github.com/KMDLabs/pos64staker/blob/master/stakerlib.py#L15

you can define an rpc proxy like 
``` kmdrpc = def_credentials('KMD')
tokenrpc=def_credentials(token_name)```
then access methods like 
```kmdrpc.getinfo()
kmdrpc.sendtoaddress(address, amount)```
this also works for Antara modules - 
```tokenrpc.oraclessamples(oracletxid, batonutxo, str(numrec))
tokenrpc.tokencreate(str(tokenname), str(tokensupply), str(tokendesc))
```

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX ^^^ shielded transaction and payment stats!!! I have a bug where it only calculates stats for blocks received since startup, so I need to figure that out, but it's getting close

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and i am keeping track of shielding/deshielding stats too, those aren't returned in json yet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i could use your advice

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i am hacking on code which I think needs to change the serialization format of CBlockIndex

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: never done that before, I know how to proceed, but I am wondering if there are things I should know. I assume my node will error and reindex if I don't remove my on-disk blocks

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: this is related to keeping track of number of shielded xtns on current mainchain, which must be serialized to disk, and read back on startup

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why would you change the ondisk blockheader?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pindex is an in memory structure, so it can be generated via whatever means

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c `nTx`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is the number of transactions seen, and it's serialized to disk

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so if i want to keep track of `nShieldedTx`, i need the same

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or else, my code only sees stuff since the last startup

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am emulating the way `nTx` and `nChainTx` work

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and extending to shielded stuff

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is area i havent changed, so not sure

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c i don't expect average nodes will enjoy a block index change on-disk, this is mostly a specialized feature. Maybe will live on a branch until the next mandatory update

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some BTC core updates do require block index refreshes, it's not unreasonable to do it sometimes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: maybe we do it as part of the Q2 2020 hard fork update

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX see, I knew this task was going to have fun little things like this 😉

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: for now, just having some servers be able to get this data via a branch is fine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why not just make a separate file that contains the data needed for this?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then it would be backward compatible

Author: dukeleto#7326
dukeleto#7326
Content: i guess this way seems "righter"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: using a diff file would be a bunch of code

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but maybe changing stuff is really dumb, which is why I am asking 🙂

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: true. maybe this is a special -zindex=1 mode and would only affect nodes with that set

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: hmm, that sounds smart

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then it wouldnt impact the normal nodes

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Yes, I want to guard this with a CLI option, defaulted to OFF. keeping track of shielded stats does use resources

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it slows down receiving blocks and loading blocks from disk, slightly, and uses more RAM

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just force a reindex if the -zindex value changes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then it can be cleanly coded and still be backward compatible

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sounds good, will try that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am doing a fresh sync, and it feels like it does slow things down a bunch

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or maybe my machine is overloaded, i need to do real tests
